t: Matthew 22
Parable of the Marriage Feast
Jesus*p spoke to them again in parables, saying,
“The*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r may*r be*r compared*r to*r a*r king*r who*r gave*r a*r wedding*r feast*r for*r his*r son.*r
And*r he*r sent*r out*r his*r slaves*r to*r call*r those*r who*r had*r been*r invited*r to*r the*r wedding*r feast,*r and*r they*r were*r unwilling*r to*r come.*r

Again*r he*r sent*r out*r other*r slaves*r saying,*r ‘Tell*r those*r who*r have*r been*r invited,*r “Behold,*r I*r have*r prepared*r my*r dinner;*r my*r oxen*r and*r my*r fattened*r livestock*r are*r all*ir butchered*r and*r everything*r is*r ready;*r come*r to*r the*r wedding*r feast.” ’*r
But*r they*r paid*r no*r attention*r and*r went*r their*r way,*r one*r to*r his*r own*r farm,*r another*r to*r his*r business,*r
and*r the*r rest*r seized*r his*r slaves*r and*r mistreated*r them*r and*r killed*r them.*r
But*r the*r king*r was*r enraged,*r and*r he*r sent*r his*r armies*r and*r destroyed*r those*r murderers*r and*r set*r their*r city*r on*r fire.*r
Then*r he*r said*r to*r his*r slaves,*r ‘The*r wedding*r is*r ready,*r but*r those*r who*r were*r invited*r were*r not*r worthy.*r
Go*r therefore*r to*r the*r main*r highways,*r and*r as*r many*r as*r you*r find*r there,*ir invite*r to*r the*r wedding*r feast.’*r

Those*r slaves*r went*r out*r into*r the*r streets*r and*r gathered*r together*r all*r they*r found,*r both*r evil*r and*r good;*r and*r the*r wedding*r hall*r was*r filled*r with*r dinner*r guests.*r
“But*rp when*r the*r king*r came*r in*r to*r look*r over*r the*r dinner*r guests,*r he*r saw*r a*r man*r there*r who*r was*r not*r dressed*r in*r wedding*r clothes,*r
and*r he*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Friend,*r how*r did*r you*r come*r in*r here*r without*r wedding*r clothes?’*r And*r the*r man*r was*r speechless.*r

Then*r the*r king*r said*r to*r the*r servants,*r ‘Bind*r him*r hand*r and*r foot,*r and*r throw*r him*r into*r the*r outer*r darkness;*r in*r that*r place*r there*r will*r be*r weeping*r and*r gnashing*r of*r teeth.’*r
For*r many*r are*r called,*r but*r few*r are*ir chosen.”*r
Tribute to Caesar
Then*p the Pharisees went and plotted together how they might trap Him in what He said.
And they sent their disciples to Him, along with the Herodians, saying, “Teacher, we know that You are truthful and teach the way of God in truth, and defer to no one; for You are not partial to any.
Tell us then, what do You think? Is it lawful to give a poll-tax to Caesar, or not?”
But Jesus perceived their malice, and said, “Why*r are*r you*r testing*r Me,*r you*r hypocrites?*r
Show*r Me*r the*r coin*r used*ir for*r the*r poll-tax.”*r And they brought Him a denarius.
And He said to them, “Whose*r likeness*r and*r inscription*r is*r this?”*r
They said to Him, “Caesar’s.” Then He said to them, “Then*r render*r to*r Caesar*r the*r things*r that*r are*r Caesar’s;*r and*r to*r God*r the*r things*r that*r are*r God’s.”*r
And hearing this,*i they were amazed, and leaving Him, they went away.
Jesus Answers the Sadducees
On*p that day some*i Sadducees (who say there is no resurrection) came to Jesus and questioned Him,
asking, “Teacher, Moses said, ‘If a*s man*s dies*s having*s no*s children,*s his*s brother*s as*s next*s of*s kin*s shall*s marry*s his*s wife,*s and*s raise*s up*s children*s for*s his*s brother.’*s
Now there were seven brothers with us; and the first married and died, and having no children left his wife to his brother;
so also the second, and the third, down to the seventh.
Last of all, the woman died.
In the resurrection, therefore, whose wife of the seven will she be? For they all had married*i her.”
But*p Jesus answered and said to them, “You*r are*r mistaken,*r not*r understanding*r the*r Scriptures*r nor*r the*r power*r of*r God.*r
For*r in*r the*r resurrection*r they*r neither*r marry*r nor*r are*r given*r in*r marriage,*r but*r are*r like*r angels*r in*r heaven.*r
But*r regarding*r the*r resurrection*r of*r the*r dead,*r have*r you*r not*r read*r what*r was*r spoken*r to*r you*r by*r God:*r
‘I*r am*sr the*sr God*sr of*sr Abraham,*r and*sr the*sr God*sr of*sr Isaac,*r and*sr the*sr God*sr of*sr Jacob’?*sr He*r is*r not*r the*r God*r of*r the*r dead*r but*r of*r the*r living.”*r
When the crowds heard this,*i they were astonished at His teaching.
But*p when the Pharisees heard that Jesus had silenced the Sadducees, they gathered themselves together.
One of them, a lawyer, asked Him a*i question,*i testing Him,
“Teacher, which is the great commandment in the Law?”
And He said to him, “ ‘You*r shall*sr love*sr the*sr Lord*sr your*sr God*sr with*sr all*sr your*sr heart,*sr and*sr with*sr all*sr your*sr soul,*sr and*sr with*sr all*sr your*sr mind.’*sr
This*r is*r the*r great*r and*r foremost*r commandment.*r
The*r second*r is*r like*r it,*r ‘You*sr shall*sr love*sr your*sr neighbor*sr as*sr yourself.’*sr
On*r these*r two*r commandments*r depend*r the*r whole*r Law*r and*r the*r Prophets.”*r
Now*p while the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them a question:
“What*r do*r you*r think*r about*r the*r Christ,*r whose*r son*r is*r He?”*r They said to Him, “The*i son*i of David.”
He said to them, “Then*r how*r does*r David*r in*r the*r Spirit*r call*r Him*r ‘Lord,’*r saying,*r
‘The*srpn Lord*sr said*sr to*sr my*sr Lord,*sr “Sit*srln at*sr My*sr right*sr hand,*sr Until*srln I*r put*sr Your*sr enemies*sr beneath*sr Your*sr feet*sr ” ’?*r
If*rp David*r then*r calls*r Him*r ‘Lord,’*r how*r is*r He*r his*r son?”*r
No one was able to answer Him a word, nor did anyone dare from that day on to ask Him another question.
